page.title: 12The Mill at Belper
page.content: The first{Mill}was built in 1776 by {Jedediah Strutt}and{Richard Arkwright. Strutt built houses for his workers and the community grew rapidly with the mill. It was water-powered and the wheels built up to 500 h.p. The stone arch over the road dates from 1800 and the square red brick mill from 1912. A modern synthetic processing plant was built in 1964.The former Strutt Mill is now English Calico. {Belper River Gardens}are on the banks of the{River Derwent}and there are rowing boats for hire. There are benches looking over the river.The Gardens are very pretty and very well looked after.There are rhodedendrons, rose bushes and willow trees which overlook a big pond.There are 3 small islands on the pond and an oriental bridge.There is a bandstand where a Brass Band plays in the Summer.
